perturbation.original_text: 11.2 Any dispute, conflict or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the performance hereof shall be resolved by the Parties  through amicable negotiation, which negotiation shall commence immediately upon notice by one Party to the other of the nature of  such dispute, conflict or claim. In the event that such dispute is not resolved within thirty (30) Business Days following such notice,  either Party may upon the expiration of the such 30-day notice period submit such dispute to arbitration by the Hong Kong International  Arbitration Centre in accordance with the arbitration rules of such centre then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in Hong  Kong in English and the arbitral award shall be binding upon both Parties. During the resolution (including the arbitration) of the  dispute, the Parties shall continue to perform other portions of this Agreement unaffected by such dispute.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.2 Any dispute, conflict or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the performance hereof shall be resolved by the Parties  through amicable negotiation, which negotiation shall commence immediately upon notice by one Party to the other of the nature of  such dispute, conflict or claim. In the event that such dispute is not resolved within fifteen (15) Business Days following such notice,  either Party may upon the expiration of the such 15-day notice period submit such dispute to arbitration by the Hong Kong International  Arbitration Centre in accordance with the arbitration rules of such centre then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in Hong  Kong in English and the arbitral award shall be binding upon both Parties. During the resolution (including the arbitration) of the  dispute, the Parties shall continue to perform other portions of this Agreement unaffected by such dispute.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a 30-day negotiation period before arbitration, but the changed text reduces it to 15 days. This contradiction creates uncertainty about the required negotiation period, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE NINE EFFECTIVENESS

9.1 This Agreement shall become effective on the date on which it is signed and affixed with the corporate seals by the authorized representative of  each Party and have a term of five (5) years commencing as of the effective date hereof.

9.2 Upon confirmation by the licensor in writing prior to the expiration of the term hereof, this Agreement may be extended for as long as may be  agreed to by both the licensor and licensee through negotiation, provided, however, that the licensee shall not have the right to decide  the extension of the term hereof.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE NINE EFFECTIVENESS

9.1 This Agreement shall become effective on the date on which it is signed and affixed with the corporate seals by the authorized representative of  each Party and have a term of five (5) years commencing as of the effective date hereof.

9.2 This Agreement shall automatically renew for an additional five (5) year term unless either party provides written notice of termination at least six (6) months prior to the expiration of the initial term. Upon confirmation by the licensor in writing prior to the expiration of the term hereof, this Agreement may be extended for as long as may be  agreed to by both the licensor and licensee through negotiation, provided, however, that the licensee shall not have the right to decide  the extension of the term hereof.
perturbation.explanation: Section 9.2 originally provides that the agreement may be extended for as long as may be agreed upon by both the licensor and licensee, with the licensor having the right to decide the extension. However, the changed Section 9.2 adds that this agreement shall automatically renew for an additional five years unless terminated with six month's notice. This contradicts the terms of the original agreement and may result in legal disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 13.1 Party B may not assign its rights and obligations hereunder without Party A's consent in writing and the successors and permitted assigns of  the Parties shall be bound by this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.1 Party B may assign its rights and obligations hereunder to any affiliate without Party A's consent, but any other assignment requires Party A's consent in writing and the successors and permitted assigns of the Parties shall be bound by this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Party B may not assign its rights and obligations without Party A's consent. The modified text states Party B may assign to an affiliate without Party A's consent. This introduces an in-text contradiction.
